content.question:
"Tantane vos generis tenuit fiducia vestri?

Iam caelum terramque meo sine numine, venti,

miscere et tantas audetis tollere moles?

Quos ego - sed motos praestat componere fluctus.

(5) Post mihi non simili poena commissa luetis.

Maturate fugam regique haec dicite vestro;

non illi imperium pelagi saevumque tridentem,

sed mihi sorte datum. Tenet ille immania saxa,

vestras, Eure, domos; illa se iactet in aula

Aeolus et clauso ventorum carcere regnet."

In the speech above, the speaker indirectly threatens his listeners with punishment if they disobey him in the future. In a short essay, discuss how the speaker conveys his anger to his listeners. Refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer. You may wish to consider such elements as word choice, word placement, meter and/or figures of speech.

vestras, Eure, domos; illa se iactet in aula
